intro: Evandra, commonly known as the wild fig or sand fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species, many of which are native to Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Evandra species often have milky sap, a common feature among members of the Euphorbiaceae family. They are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
